intro: Erigeron aegyptiacus, commonly known as Egyptian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow to white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas, roadsides, and dry grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
